values:
never realized how impossible it must have been,
setting myself on unacceptable axioms.

~
was it too much to expect you 
to see me as how i wanted you to see me. 
beautiful, frail, prevailing, lost. 
floating on a surface of contradictions. 

but maybe it should be enough
for me to try to be the things
i dream myself to be
for me alone. 

you'll love me as i want you to love me or you don't.
~

this is the shedding of facade. 
the abandonment of awkwardness.

So I have to face that I'm a big fat coward and get over it. I mean I finally have the means and I don't even want try it. I need to stop making fuckin' excuses.

"Sarah, I wish I could be at Dalhousie so we could talk over coffee and chocolate glazed croissants."

I really should have figured out how do deal with this by now. No really, after all those years and all those days and all those hours, you think I would've have learned how. Maybe I've been going about the wrong way or maybe I'm just ineffectual. 

I think I just need to spend time with friends. Next Wednesday should be a relief.

Ted pointed out to me something I didn't realize that people might get the wrong impression of. To clarify, I didn't post that stuff Dave wrote to me so you guys feel sorry for me or think Dave as a dick. Certainly the opposite; I wanted people to empathize with dave in hating me and get his side out. I'm sorry if it appears the opposite. 

Here's the truth: 
I was a bitch and shouldn't have done any of the following (in no particular order).
- I blamed Dave for my own procrastination.
- I blamed him for failing in school.
- I lied to him about wanting to work things out because I couldn't handle the drama. (this issue was a little touchy for me because it's kind of a reaction that i HAD to use with my dad.)
- I hung up on him when he was crying.
- I tried to break up with him near his birthday.
- I started being annoyed by his displays of affections.
- I made him do favors for me and didn't return them back. 
- I held grudges because I didn't know how to compromise properly.
- I was very rarely sincere with my apology and provide correct grievances.
- I'll run away from a fight.
- I didn't take his criticism seriously.

- I should've never told Dave I loved him when I wasn't ready.
- I should've never gone out with him to leave him like that.


Again, not asking you to feel sorry for me. I can live with all of the above, so that should tell you how un-empathetic I can be. 

If there's something I'm missing, feel free to add.

i've been searching for a way to get my lj to update new entries from my http://sandie-in-uni.blogspot.com/, which is the one i tried to use more often. well i have yet to be successful or understand all this rss feed nonsense. lj support said the following: While it is not possible to have a syndicated feed update your LiveJournal account, third-party software may be available to accomplish similar behavior. LiveJournal Support cannot recommend or offer assistance with any such software and you may wish to search for it using your preferred search engine. continued to search.

blah.

Nobody told you, that I could just waltz through and shake up your style. I'm Inside, like a wrecking ball through your eyes, And I change it all from inside. ~ interpol *********************************** ha ha, my mood icon on relaxed looks like it's on e. wow. lj. havent' done this for a while. i don't even remember my user names and passwords for my other accounts. now should i start using this account or just continue using my blogger account? i hate having two or three blogs for things... but there are a few people i know who are still using it. meh. i'm feeling very nostalgic and having these weird reminiscing episodes which sometimes make me cringe a little. i haven't been like that for a while, at least for a year and a half. i don't mind it. i feel very full from the experience. i wonder how full i'll feel when i'm eighty and have eighty years of memories to go through. i hate how i screwed up this year, academic wise. but i'm not too upset if i can make up for it this year. yay for physics. boo for making it difficult. so i'll have no life next year (not that i did this year for other reasons). people have been telling me about relationships stories which is a subject i'm not very well versed in, lol. but i kind of find it funny and a little insulted. i understand these people are venting, and that's totally needed. however, for example, this guy i met at the observatory is telling how he gets screwed over because he's always trying to be the nice guy and the girl never pays attention to him or stays with him... that and because he's a physicist. he seems like a very mature and smart guy, and it made it that more amusing to see him talk about grade/high school relationships. but i'm sitting there thinking... wait, this guy keeps telling me of how he's going after the girl every guy wants and every girl wants to be. first mistake; why doesn't he ever pick the nice girls to go out with, instead of the class hottie. second he tells me how he tries to be sincere and cool with the girls but is now being bitter about being sincere and cool to them because they didn't return feelings, not totally altruistic in my opinion. but seriously, you are a dick if you are nice to a girl but turn a cold shoulder once you realize she doesn't intend to sleep with you. a dick with a persona. i hope i don't get bitter when someone breaks my heart. i hope i can still understand that it was their decision, a decision they are free to make, and something they have to live with as well. and if the relationship failed because of my faults, then i hope i can realize what they are and fixed them so that it will work out better with the next person i care about. but seeing how touchy it is, i'm not sure i could handle it as well as i hope i can.

"What if you lived through a genocide and nobody believed you?"
"Then you would be in Cambodia.
~ CBC announcer

What if you lived through a genocide and nobody really believed you, not even the major news media, and the 'free world' denies it?
Then you would be in East Timor.


Blagh.

Even less known about than Cambodia:  Burma.

I heart Amy Goodman.  She has the most delicate hands and clear voice.

Plus, I got sucked into YouTube's Nobody's Watching duo the other day. So much wasted time.

Eli, the barrowboy, you're the old town 
Sells coal and marigolds and he cries out all down the day 
Below the tamarac she is crying 
Corn cobs and candlewax for the buying, all down the day 

Would I could afford to buy my love a fine robe 
Made of gold and silk arabian thread 
She is dead and gone and lying in a pine grove 
And I must push my barrow all the day 
And I must push my barrow all the day 

Eli, the barrowboy, when they found him 
Dressed all in corduroy, he had drowned in the river down the way 
They laid his body down in a churchyard 
But still when the moon is out, with his pushcart, he calls down the day 

Would I could afford to buy my love a fine gown 
Made of gold and silk arabian thread 
But I am dead and gone and lying in a church ground 
But still I push my barrow all the day 
Still I push my barrow all the day

~The Decemberists, "Eli, The Barrow Boy"
You don't need to know, but I feel like I need to relieve my bladder all the time and my stomach is giving me headaches.  I'm such an old lady.

I try to be the first to admit to a flaw, a fault, a mistake.  So I'll admit to being stuck in the libertarian stigma.  

Free will, it doesn't exist. I can say that and believe it, but what does it really mean to me?   Does that mean you have no choice? Does it mean a criminal is not at fault for his crimes?   In-doctrine truth says no.  We like to believe we have choice.  The illusion is that we have choice.  We like to think one's actions are explicitly the result of that one person.  But if you take one moment of out of your life to think about how you got where you are.  In that room, reading this article, on that computer, on this live journal, meeting me, getting a computer, internet existing, you existing, computers inventing.... It goes back to what seems infinity.  Were these factors in your control?  What we call "decision" or "choice" is really just our response to the environment and past experiences and consequential thoughts, it is part of being a living organism. There's nothing wrong about or abnormal or inhuman about it.

So back to the questions: Does that mean you have no choice? Does it mean a criminal is not at fault for his crimes? If Free Will does not exist, then the answer is really yes. No matter how much you don't want to believe it.  Does that mean my life is pointless to live, because all my "decisions" have been made for me? No because I don't find that a useful way to live.  And I don't find that a useful way to live because I've tried in the past, and it made life suck.  And I tried it in the past because I had thought of this same dilemma, and I thought of this dilemma because... well that's as far as I can remember.  But can you see, do you realize that my responses are built on top of other responses, experiences, and other influences.  My responses are not predetermined in a sense you can predict it indefinitely (mainly because there are just too many factors involved: the way your brain is wired, way other people are wired, the weather, the responses of all the people in the world)?  But you can predict a probability of how people will respond through science (ie psychology) and research (ie statistics). And when people use that knowledge to control people, there's where we have mind numbing media and horribly intensively purposeful propaganda.  So once you introduce a new thought, once you experience something else, once other people have effected you in their own predetermined way, you're already setting yourself for a whole different future then you might have seen yourself a moment ago (even the thought of the future is affecting your future and that thought was caused by something else (it's just so hard to keep track of causes because you can keep going)).

As for the question of the criminal.  Should we kill a murderer because their life has led them to kill someone else?  I don't think so.  Should we let the murderer go? Uh, no! Should we lock them away in prisons that would just negatively influence them?  That doesn't solve anything except keep them away from the public for a set time, and possibly allowing them to negatively influence other prisoners.  The solution should be to find the cause of why they murdered and treat them, and allow them to be positive influences, and re-enter society no longer as a murderer.  I know this sounds all hippy-cock.  But you and I both know prisons the way they are now don't work.  And more sickening, they can be forced to do outsourced work without pay.

Wait, what about quantum indeterminacy! You science geeks like I know you are will ask.  Doesn't quantum indeterminacy allow for chance?  Um. I don't know if you haven't notice, but we don't live in a quantum world.  Our cells don't even live in a quantum world.  Micro-organisms don't live in quantum worlds.  Nano-organisms are the closest to living in a quantum world.  And even they probably don't get affected by quantum physics (don't quote me on that. I'm still a physicist in-training).  I don't really believe that life as we know it can be derived from at the quantum scale.  But you got me, I have no proof for this.  But it will be my mission to find it.  But it just makes sense.  (And yes, common sense is not the best use of evidence.  But common sense also says we have free will too.)  I love the quote Dave gave me or I read somewhere about this general or ceo or someone relatively smart decided to put two and two together.  Goes something like: If my atoms are mostly empty space, and wall atoms are mostly empty space... omg I can hypothetically walk through walls!  *Runs at wall.* OUCH! Ooops forgot about CHEMISTRY.  Of course atoms having electric fields and forming bonds and intermolecular forces are involved but I hope it is somewhat analogical. I'm sure string theory or that unified theory of everything will be able to tie in quantum universe to human-size universe together, and I will be very interested to learn how it works (biochemistry may greatly benefit), but even then it probably will give proof that quantum indeterminacy does not mean our lives are based purely on chance. At least not since the beginning of the universe. 

In conclusion, how the machinery of our lives work shouldn't change the fact we should be striving for global social justice.  All it does is clarify how we can go about.  And how people have used our determinacy to their advantage and purposefully keep us in the Free Will loophole.  (Even debating about Free Will keeps us in the loophole. So I will not be entertaining any arguments, I'll just have to work on writing a more scientifically proven essay.) All I can ask, is that you take that one second to seriously think of how you got where you are in life.  (Hey if an 16 -year-old me entertained it. You certainly can.) And just hypothetically assume life without Free Will and if the brain freeze doesn't kill you, maybe you can stop believing in libertarianism and then de-constructing all the political policies that are based on it and taking advantage of our belief in libertarian values.

[I am so going to be tagged because of this aren't I. Damn.]

I haven't even gotten past page 15 of Pirates and Emperors, Old and New by Chomsky (because it takes forever to read the ultra articulate paragraphs) and I already feel like blowing large regions of U.S.A. up. How fucked is that? Really, all I feel is renewed disgruntlement over the whole Lebanon affair of the summer. Only because it's the only one that I was aware of. I wasn't even able grasp the whole situation of how U.S.A. could easily defy the UN and invade Iraq before it was done. Everything before that, I was too dumb fucked to know or comprehend or care. Now this summer "crisis" has faded to the background. After a year, we won't even remember how a nation's capital city, major airport, and billions of dollars of infrastructure that took years to built because of previous wars is ruined in a span of a few weeks because two soldiers of an USA client country were captured. I ate too much too. Enough to keep a family in Sudan running for a week. I'm going on a fast. Just tea, oranges, and instant oatmeal. P.S. Hey Zhee, you need to give me details of what you obtained from going to Sudan. I'll help anyway I can. And Sietske is a pretty neat girl.

Now I have to really lose all, while still give the demeanor that I don't. A struggle only of my perception. This is going to be so fucken hard. If I'm not going to die physically, the least I can do is destroy this current persona. What arises from that I don't know. Hopefully not a psychopath.

I realized after watching The Good Sheppard, being near the end of Crime and Punishment, and after my own internal duel, that one real crime is lying to yourself. Lying to others can be justified in some circumstances. But you're worthless if you lie to yourself. What is left if it is all just a matter of denial and perspective? Nothing, that's what. So everything can become nothing to me. And being nothing is everything to me. . . . But is there really anything to worthiness and meaning? ______________________________________ To: quell the futility I only look at you with burning eyes Because I wish you could: - wipe tears away - kiss eyelids - hold fainted body Can you dismiss them so easily? From: inadequacy ______________________________________ Damn. I'm hungry and want more of that pizza.

Oh here it goes it again.
I should've known again.
Oh here it goes. 
~OK Go
-----

First Christmas I spent semi-normally.  I got an agenda, earrings, scarf w/ matching gloves, chocolates, lip gloss (mmmmmmmmmmm), Su doku work book, and bath set.  I wonder if I'm supposed to write Thank You cards?  I think I want to, but I'm just hoping that it isn't too haughty.

Why does today always feel like the whole world is secretly waking up with me?  

I fell asleep at about 3am and woke up around 6:30am just in time to finish up writing my cards and put my gifts downstairs.

I had a weird dream in between.  I dreamt I had to pretend I was dead or had to hide away from a some mafia boss with the help of a friend and a boyfriend and I was pregnant at the same time.  It was very Kill Bill or Alias.  The first time, the bf or guy hero helped me get out.  The second time a friend came and told me the guy hero had died and I had to hide in the basement of the house I was at because the Mafia boss was coming here and there was not time to go out or the place was guarded. And it ended with me stuck in a room with a gunshot through the door. Because of the sucky ending, I redreamt the second dream's ending, so the third time was like the second except the gunshot went through the friend before it went through the door, with the possibility of my friend shooting at least some of the mafia.

I'm sorry I'm not a better person.

Well I unduly suck at this.  I'm never going to take things seriously again.  Because 'things' just let you down. 

My sister wants to go live the slow life in Italy. Who wouldn't??

Sooo many broken pretzel fences.  So much carnage.

And the elevator at the station smells like pee... ew.

Stamina failing.  Sleep wait no longer.  
Weariness lull me to this illogical trance
Where reality is fiction and truth.

So I can roll with it.  I hate not knowing because then I'm just flopping back and forth.

Days do not come soon enough and go by too soon.

What I've learned: 
1.) Cry when you fucken feel like even if you have no clue why because you feel fucken better after.
2.) Never forget my life strategy.
------>No regrets.
------>Nothing matters in time.
3.) Communicate and break the social isolation stigma.

Maybe the reason is the fact I involved myself more than I was supposed. 
God I luv determinism.

-------
Today was alright.  I got something for someone's mom and two skirts for myself.  I've been wondering what to get for my sis.  I know I can get my bro-in-law an amp for his electric guitar.  I'm thinking of getting her theatre tickets. Should I get three or just two?  I'm thinking it would be the two of us, but would it be right to leave out her hubby or a friend? Not that her hub would want to go (unless it was actiony).  And I don't really want her to think she has to take me, because then it's like I bought it for myself and not for her, so maybe I'll get her two and insist on not being the one going.  I know she'll 'preciate shakespeare, but it should be a night off for her, and she doesn't need to be confuzzeled with Shakespearean language. I'll have to check out where the ticket master is and what shows are available, and all that shizaz.

Things that happened on this venture were mostly a surprise, in a good way.  God can I sleep.  Arrived home from work around 1.  Fell asleep for 4 hours.  

I've learned one thing for sure, I shouldn't consume copious amounts of caffeine on minimal amounts of food.  Went to play billiards with Dave.  I suck most royally at the game, but I find it addictive to play none the less.  However, I don't think I will play it again while sober.  I have officially and indefinitely tied alcohol with pool.  And since pool is addictive, I think I see where I'm going to be drunk.  

I met up with Sarah.  She most willingly followed me while I aimlessly promenaded down King.  But it was awesome to talk with her.  Saw Maggie too!  Of course we three talked about Kevin.  Oh his bio nerdiness will be remembered forever.  

I had a lady calling from Scotland wishing to buy a giftcard for her son.  The transaction took about 45 minutes to complete.  She had an awesome accent.  I really hope her giftcard doesn't get lost now.  My driver's license did eventually come.  So maybe there is faith left in our postal service.
My feet hurt. I am a mean fucker. I'm going to go cook (; wish me luck).
Danced for hours. Feet sore. Head level. Too bad it was too formal for a mosh pit.

Thank god I'm fucken high on sugar and caffeine because I would never have done that otherwise.

I feel really good since ages.  A little less good than I was an hour ago, but at least not feeling like I have my face under someone's boot like I used to after something like that.  
. 
.
.
Hey, that's my plan, WAS my plan.  Plans change.  I could never cut it in EEngg anyways.
.
.
.
How do I use the memory function on my calculator again... I forget...
.
.
.
I'm not afraid of fading. W00t.  I'm not afraid of anything again. W00t to life.

I should probably stop doing that because I know I'm only doing it for the attention.

Anyone want to teach me how to play an instrument?

And I want to go play billiards.

Yesterday I had three different phone conversations with three different people.  That's a record for me since I barely ever use the phone before.  I need to be way more productive.

<lj-cut text="This is for Dawe.">
So, I'm supposed to be writing about my 'avoiding' tendencies right?  Actually I'm exercising it right now. I'm avoiding calling people I was calling a week ago.  Nice. Why do I like to avoid people? Because I'm a passive person, who doesn't give a fuck.  I mean that should be enough to explain things right?  I guess this is one reason I left home.  I could never say anything to my parents without getting some huge lecture or backlash so I stop bothering.  There's also that idea in my head to shut up and be submissive because if you retaliate you're just a annoying bitch.  Not that it stops me from being an annoying bitch.  Then there's me using my nihilism as an excuse not to bother with anything.  Basically I give up; I'm a quitter, that's why I avoid.  You can't change people.  You shouldn't try to change people.  So if they win the argument, that's great for them.  I don't care either way; I'm not hurt, no one's hurt.  So what if I get offended and don't say anything.  It's not like you'll change your opinions because of it.  More likely you'll think I'm a dumb twit either way: for saying something different or for not saying anything, so why say.  Secondly I'm tired of being the one to call certain people all the fucken time.  If you don't want me in your life, I'm not going to force anything.  Everyone's busy, and I wouldn't make room for you if I didn't have any either.  There, that's also me and my past experiences being the odd one out every time and left out of everything and so now this is how I handle rejection.

This is not self pity.  This is just how I feel.  And any comments on this section other than from Dawe or Sarah will be ignored because you don't mean it anymore than I do.

See Dave, I can't make sense of anything even if I tried.  I don't know why you wanted so much for me to write this.

</lj-cut>

I was going to type about my avoiding tendencies to somehow make it coherent to myself and Dawe. But that very thought seems a little too egotistic right now.  

The car got broken into. The people were trying to steal the rims.  I hate getting robbed.  It's the shits because you feel futile.

I find it difficult to write or do anything lately that isn't absolutely required of me.  I officially suck more so than before.
I am a very selfish unapologetic person.
I am stuffed with Vietnamese food. Yay, no work today.

You know who I've been gravely neglecting: Philip K. Dick.  Him and Calculus... and the slew of books on  my shelf.  Dear lord I want to finish up this Wiccan project and go learn French and fractals.

Three cheers to energy drinks, the liquified version of caffeine pills.  Won't Mr. Miller be proud of us now.

Today was tedious. Woke up late. Realize I overbudget and am as broke as hell.   Did not have time to pack food. It was pay day w/o the fun of frivolously spending all the money away. Lugged around stuff I didn't really need.  And was a dollar over in my till.  

Coming back home from work.  Met with some 20 something Egyptian guy named Marcos who was very nice and Orthodox.  Apparently going to Centennial in a 3 year tourism program he described as easy but a lot of memorizing of codes.  Going off topic, hey Zhee, where is Ali from anyways?

I also must find time to watch "The Search for the Holy Grail" I borrowed from someone.  My goodness can this cat purr.

I don't know where time want.  I was going to do my project after talking to Zhee, and somehow managed to consume 6hrs of pointless tv watching and web surfing.  See this is why I am afraid to take anything.  If I can get hooked on simple crap like that, I'll just run my ass in the ground exponentially quicker if I do anything else.  Needless to say, I will again be staying up tonight because I have work tomorrow night, working most of Saturday, and have to put the project together with my partner on Sunday.  So I better have most of the work done now since it is due on Monday. 

I have gotta get better self discipline.

I have been up since 7 in the morning yesterday.

I had a nonstop nine hour and a minute phone conversation with Dave.

In all this course of time, I've had only 4 cups of tea and 2 coffees, and both were weak.

This must be a new record for me, 40 hours of wakefulness/drowsiness/hyperness/inability to stop talking or laughing.

Now, I'm going to sleep.

I feel like repeatedly walking into a wall, slamming into a wall wall, til I'm fucken bruised and bloody.  The only lesson I've learned from all this crap, is that life is the fucken loneliest thing right now.  I feel like some clingy bitch and I just want to shoot myself for it.  I don't feel.  I don't feel a fucken thing. I don't miss anyone.  I don't miss anyone.  I just miss company.  I don't even fucken care if you all get fucken tortured and killed.  The less the merrier.  I don't know why I even feel this fucken numb.  I don't even feel suicidal.  Fuck I'm so selfish. I want to live and everyone to be gone. Be gone.

I have no direction.  I have no desire.  I have no idea what the fuck to do now except wait.  And why must I use fuck in every sentence.  Fuck that shit. I've been saying "Fuck that shit" too much nowadays.

This is told.  This is the same old story.  This is annoying.

I'm done.  If you want to talk to me, you talk to me first.  Because I'm tired of the one talking first.  Because I'm tired of trying.  Let relationships wither, because all life does eventually.

And should I initiate first, it's for me and I expect nothing in return.

Everything means nothing to me now.  So this is the punishment, the consequence I get.  This is karma biting me in the ass.  It's a lose-lose situation.  I could never win in the first place.  

Fuck, now I wish I had an addiction to fall on.

I was at a mall yesterday and every freaken brand store I want to had their products made in China. 

Some people in my job training class believe that making money is the most important thing and it doesn't matter how. Depressing.  I started thinking, they're all Gail Wynands, but that's assuming they are intelligent.  Otherwise they're are just selfish unaware fucks.  But I guess they aren't too bad, even the annoying 'anime-watching-graphic-designer wannabe' that keeps saying "foxfire".

Thank goodness I believe that nothing matters and it's all in your head.

I had an interview today.  Went fairly well.  I have an interview tomorrow, and I don't think the guy will be too kind hearted... so worries.  

Trying to get a job is ... interesting.  Sadly I miss school, or maybe just the structured day that comes from it.  Yes, I'm weird.

I want to see people from before.  Am I just clingy and unable to move away from the past?  Or maybe it's the lack of people I can comfortably talk to.


----

I very confused now. Blah, I'm supposed to be over my teen-life crisis.
As ref to dave's post: I'm spreading the ayn rand seed. Virus of the mind, remember? Viruses of the mind. http://www.cscs.umich.edu/~crshalizi/Dawkins/viruses-of-the-mind.html

"Hi."
"Hey."
"Wait do you know who it is?"
"Yes, I usually recognize someone after I talk to them once on the phone."
"You still sound weird."
"Aha. ... How are you?"
"I'm okay. I'm having dinner with ______."
"Ah."
"Where are you?"
"At home. I'm trying to make a program to multiply matrices."
"You know I tune out at the thought of programming."
"Well you know matrices from data management..."
"Discrete.  But no, don't try to explain."
"So you're okay?"
"Yes. Actually ______ and everyone seems to be asking that."
"I don't doubt it. So where are you going to?"
"I don't know. Some uni later, maybe. I actually have to come in tomorrow to withdraw from my courses."
"Oh, cool.  Do you want to do something when you come?"
"Ha. No, I will be with -------."
"Okay. You're okay then? Aha."
"I'm okay. Here ______ wants to talk to you."

***
The moral of the phone convo is I'm okay.  And that I'm bored and may randomly call you.

Stupid fucks. Forget me. I hate you all. I hate myself. I hate my stubbornness. Now I'm stuck asking help from someone else.  Stupid JCU with your fucken interview.  How the fuck am I supposed to study in Australia with no fucken money.  And you're crying now. You're crying now and I don't care. Ha. What the fuck is my life worth anyways. Nothing.
